review:
I am half way through this game and I am loving it! So many different robots and maps, so I must think of different ways to defeat them every time. I had so many close shaves but tries something new and beat the enemy robot. It's fun to play with friends too, though not so many players in the online.

I wanted to post a quick review now, but will add more when it is all finished.

review:

Okay i give it a good review
I think you can give translation work to the enthusiastic netizens in the community like a "slay the spirte"

developer_response:
Thank you so much for your kind words about the game.

We'd love to be able to translate the game into Chinese as well as many other languages. However we are indie developer, the game has over 35,000 words, and we simply do not have the budget to do that. Translation is expensive.

If you do like this game, please reconsider giving us a positive review as that is what helps us to work on this game and others in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966082557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1638818365}
review:
This is a very enjoyable strategy game. Whimsical and fun. I highly suggest you get the Deluxe Edition, with all the DLC included. I like the graphics and music, and I've had fun playing.
I think, however, the dlc could be cheaper in price, and battles can sometimes go on too long. But the game remains enjoyable and original. Highly recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561198043773891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1539330421}
review: This game is elegant and polished, and loads of fun to play! As someone who doesn't play card battlers much, I appreciated the way that different, simple mechanics built on eachother in ways that added strategic depth, without overcomplicating the system. On top of great gameplay, the visual polish and charm of the aesthetic is incredible, and it's always so exciting seeing what new robot faces will show up in the world :) Overall, great, punchy, and fun. Easy to pick up and allows for lots of unique strategy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198377279790', 'num_games_owned': 924, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1521401156}
review:
OK, I have to be honest about two things the first being that I didn't pay for this game, I was given a code, the second being that I have a strong aversion to card games. They are a massive YAWN for me. 

BUT.

I loved this game. After about an hour of extremely entertaining gameplay I realised that I was instinctively doing all the things you do in a card game but haviung fun. The battles seeem very immediate and visceral, the characters have real character and the exploration is intriguing. 

I have only just scratcthed the surface of this game but have fallen in love. There is lots more to do, adventures to be had, battles to be won! A game I would have bought, for sure, had I not been given a code.

author: {'steamid': '76561198337581261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1019, 'last_played': 1578863444}
review:
It deliver a 15 hour campaign as promised in the description of the game, and although it having a few cons overall its enjoyable.

Lets start at the pro's

- Fun multiplayer 
- Extra difficult levels, providing replayabilty value
- Easy to get into
- Appealing card battling
- Updates promised

And the cons

- Small multiplayer community (at the time of writeing this review)
- May feel grindy at times

author: {'steamid': '76561198364779756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1535482963}
review:
The best way I'd describe this game is "a card battle game for people who don't do card battle games". You don't have to worry about building and sorting the precise deck, you don't have to worry about being matched against people with better decks. You all get the same but the order is random so the battles are fair more often than not. The battles are of a good length so they keep their excitement and intensity.

The single player mode takes the model above and adds the option to enhance your robot with extra abilities but still maintains that simplicity and easy to pick up. Each turn you move your robot around the board, pick up currency, add the abilities and then you're ready to fight. Some abilities apply outside the battles themselves which does a add a tactical element without bogging them down. The enjoyment is further enhanced by the quirky style of the robots, each has it's own personality and its bright colour scheme just adds to that. 

If you're looking for a game to have a blast, then you can't too far wrong with Insane Robots. For a card battle game, it's more focused on the fun than building deck, perfect for people who don't play card battle games.

Highly recommend

Disclaimer - I won this in their Discord competition and own it for the XBox also

author: {'steamid': '76561197988047100', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 739, 'last_played': 1534363539}
review:
I'm a veteran of card based games, like ES Legends and Hearthstone and this sits right up there in terms of pure fun, for me. It's simplistic yet has a level of complexity that doesn't overwhelm you, like some card battling games. You can lay back, play and just enjoy the game. Something feels special about playing survival cards, waiting for that perfect combo and unleashing it.

Great game, highly recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198141478563', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1168, 'last_played': 1624924193}
review: I believe that this game is great. It has a good story, balanced battle mechanics and a great development team. Perfect for when you don't know what to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026482109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1532000177}
review:
Too simplistic for my taste. (Just wait for the right, randomly generated card.)

After ~1 hr of playing, I can still only minorly tweak my base deck. (No direct deck building.)

Deck modification is done through augments, but augment progression way to slow to strategize between the options. 
(I literally got 2 after ~1 hr, and I would need around 10 choices to have some interesting "deck building".)

Has some positive aspects though:
+ Nice graphics & UI.
+ Nice soundtrack.
+ I like the way they did "voicelines".
+ Might be a bit more interesting after several hours of playing(?)
developer_response:
Hi LordIntel,

Thanks for your review of Insane Robots.

I can confirm that it does take about 1 hour of play before most of the 22 tokens in the battle deck are unlocked, so it's likely you will not have seen the full variety of play after only 45 mins.

If you only saw 2 augments, it sounds like you were only gaining them through narrative events. You can find more augments in the tournament shops. There are 2-4 shops per arena, each containing 4 augments (as well as other power ups), so in a 1 hour session you could potentially find more than 30 augments if that was your focus. More unlock each tournament (over 100 in total) and they are also all unlocked in multiplayer.

Hope that helps and have fun if you decide to return to the game!

All the best,

Rob

author: {'steamid': '76561197971271027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1532293966}
review:
Ein rundenbasiertes, Battle-Cards-Strategie Spiel mit RPG Elementen? Eigentlich ja so überhaupt nicht mein Genre. Trotzdem muss ich sagen, das hier macht irgendwie Spaß. Ich versteh nur noch nicht so ganz warum... 

Ein kurzes "Angezockt" findet ihr hier:
https://youtu.be/WAJAE2polsg 

Pro:
- Comic-Grafik... wirklich sehr nett gemacht.
- Soundtrack (erinnert mich irgendwie an die guten alten Western)
- Einfach zu lernen, schwer zu meistern
- Witzige Figuren

Kontra:
- Könnte schnell etwas eintönig werden, auch wenn der Schwierigkeitsgrad gut ansteigt
- leider nur auf Englisch (ist ja noch im Early Access...)
- Die "Versus-Bildschirme" verschwinden etwas zu schnell, ich konnte die Gegener-Beschreibungen meist nicht ganz lesen
- Meckern ist bei diesem Spiel nur auf hohem Niveau (nicht die Handcreme) möglich

Würde ich mir dieses Spiel kaufen? Nö. Es ist halt einfach nicht mein Genre. Allerdings muss man sagen, dass ich bisher richtig viel Spaß hatte, die kleinen Roboter aufeinander losgehen zu lassen. Der Anspruch - für Spieler wie mich, die keinen Plan haben was sie da tun, weil sie keine Wumme am rechten Bildschirmrand sehen - ist angenehm und dieser Satz viel zu lang, was ihr sicherlich schon bemerkt und, so vermute ich, auch schon deutlich durch ekstatisches Schimpfen zum Ausdruck gebracht habt... 

Kurz gesagt: Dieses Spiel hat es geschafft meine Abneigung gegen "Kampfkartenspiele" ein wenig zu verringern. Das will schon was heißen!

INFO: Dieses Spiel wurde uns kostenlos zur Verfügung gestellt, unsere Meinung beeinflusst das aber nicht! Wenn das Spiel Müll ist, bringen wir es vor die Tür, Wenn es gut ist, kommt es ins Regal!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989513924', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1531921700}
review:
An okay card-battler but I found it rather laborious. Battles have a habit of going on forever but lack the mechanical variety required to keep the excitement running over long card exchanges.

To its credit, the battle system is deceptively complex - at first it seems very simple and one dimensional but it does expand in depth quite quickly with the introduction of about half a dozen different "blocks" that can be used during fights to your advantage (or disadvantage).

When weighing up the time I enjoyed with the game versus the time I spent wishing things would just move along, I ultimately feel it's more of a thumbs down than a thumbs up for me. It's a casual card battler and that's fine - the complexity isn't something I have an issue with.

It's more that by the time I actually finish a battle, I feel more a sense of relief as opposed to satisfaction or accomplishment. Everything is too "slow", which I feel is out of tandem with the casual card battling market the game is trying to appeal to. Check out my full explanation of the game's ups and downs here - https://youtu.be/znfWP-RCadE
developer_response:
Hi MaltedBampot,

Thanks for your review of Insane Robots.

I wanted to reassure you that AI opponents get tokens with exactly the same probability as you (unless that probability is modified with an augment), including Damage tokens. AIs also have no unfair advantages - they fight with the same knowledge as human players. Actually, the tokens are not as random as they might seem - everyone gets the same tokens and the same fuel, just in random order and random combination. We call this a Tetris deck (based on how probability works in that game).

Damage tokens were introduced to make battles finite, prevent resource "farming" in battles and, when used right, maximise overkill. But also they are a "dirty" way to end a battle - you get no overkill bonus that way. 

Finally, you said that the same song is played constantly throughout the game, but this is not the case. The game actually has a soundtrack of more than 50 tracks, and they were all professionally edited for inclusion in the game. (The title track intentionally doesn't loop, because of its live intro and outro, though it does remain on beat when restarting.)

Thanks,

Rob

author: {'steamid': '76561198110209624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1549728849}

Battles, cards, turn based and more. There is much replayability with tournements and achieving 3 stars can be difficult, at least for me. This game is well polished and an all around great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282335679', 'num_games_owned': 5099, 'num_reviews': 878, 'playtime_forever': 834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 834, 'last_played': 1531535967}
review:
很古怪的卡牌對戰遊戲, 敵我可以隨便地把攻防數值搞得亂七八糟。
明明很努力令自己的攻防數值達至最高, 下個回合有機會被搞到變成全部0。

由於沒有自己組牌的功能, 抽到甚麼是隨緣, 似乎不會因為你手持A卡, 就不再抽到A卡。
卡片可以在戰鬥中靠合成來換牌, 抽不到攻防卡時, 可以說是最後的手段吧?

每個機械人除了原始的特殊能力外, 都可以更換。
特殊能力很多, 有各樣古怪效果。

故事模式的戰鬥是在地圖中四處跑, 你有你去撿錢/觸發事件, 他們有他們亂打... orz
目標是: 生存過關! 否則你得到的新能力全部化為烏有!

因為隨機性很高, 比較適合休閒性質耍樂。估計玩家的特殊能力增加到某一個程度後, AI將會完全不敵玩家。
______________________________________

Edit:
玩了6小時, 我覺得並不是快節奏的戰鬥, 因為, 打得慢比較多錢。 +__+
快節奏估計是你定型後的沒技能要買的時候的事... (仍繼續玩嗎? 大概變成單純的online對戰了。)

不過, 8個主角機械人獨立的, 如果你要練滿8隻, 要花點時間。

author: {'steamid': '76561198079351783', 'num_games_owned': 577, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 1573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1084, 'last_played': 1626954132}
review:
Wunderschönes rundenbasiertes Card-Battling-Game

´Ne schöne Kampagne und (fast) sämtliche Online/Lokal-MP-Optionen sind mit von der Partie. Ständig Blitzt und Blinkt etwas auf, was man freischaltet hat (so Eyecandy mag ich ja besonders :D). Seien es neue Maps, Tuniere, Roboter, usw.

Alle, die sich über das Spiel informieren wollen, sollten auf jeden Fall 2 Videos in Betracht ziehen.

Ein mal dieses kurze und informative Video, wie das Spiel zustande kam:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DjUpfRuSIi8

und dann naürlich die Serie auf meinen Kanal, für die mir dankenswerterweise auch der Key für das Game zur Verfügung gestellt wurde.

https://youtu.be/tKW14lGaPTE

Viel Spaß
